intro: Schismus koelerioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial that produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. Schismus koelerioides is often found in rocky soils and is considered a characteristic species of desert scrub habitats.
